Package GameObject

Provides all the objects required during the GamePlay state of the game.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Bomb This class creates an object used to represent the bombs placed by the player during gameplay.
BrickWall Used to represent the BrickWall objects placed on the grid at fixed positions during GamePlay.
ConcreteWall Used to represent the ConcreteWall objects placed on the grid at fixed positions during GamePlay.
Door Used to represent the door object that allows the player to progress through the stages of the game after having killed all the enemies present in a stage.
Enemy Used to represent the enemy objects present in the game.
EnemySet Used to represent the enemy sets present in each stage of the game.
Flame Used to represent the flame object that is displayed once a bomb explodes.
GameObject Parent class to every object present in the game.
KillSet Class used as a container to store the data needed to calculate the score obtained from a bomb blast.
MovableObject Defines the common functionality shared by all the objects that can move on the grid.
Player Used to represent the Player object on the Game Grid.
PowerUp Used to create the powerUp object hidden in every non-bonus stage during gameplay.
StageData Defines a model used to specify how stages can be created, and the specific interface needed to generate the enemy and powerup information on the Grid.
Stages Defines the data contained in each of the 50 stages present in the game.
StaticObject Defines the common functionality shared by all the objects that cannot move on the grid.
TileMap The TileMap class is used to represent the map or grid where GamePlay takes place.
 

Enum Summary
Direction Defines the motions that a movable object can perform in the game.
EnemyType Enum containing the constants used to represent the Enemy types present in the game.
PowerUpType Constants representing the types of powerups present in the game
 

Package GameObject Description

Provides all the objects required during the GamePlay state of the game. Defines the logic and interactions between these objects.
